segments.text: I observe the woman in the kitchen, polishing that plate like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she ignore the water gushing from the sink?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's flooding the counter and floor, what a mess she's allowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle, and she doesn't even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids, those little rascals, are raiding the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on that stool is being so reckless, it's infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can't they just ask nicely instead of sneaking around?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is helping him, reaching up like it's all a game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This disobedience right under the adult's nose is unacceptable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water damage to the cabinets will be a nightmare to fix.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And if the stool tips, there'll be broken dishes and tears.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just get so frustrated seeing this carelessness everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR
